item.title: Backward Reasoning
item.description: Definition Backward reasoning, or backward chaining, is one of the two main methods for reasoning about the correctness of a program (the other being forward reasoning).

item.title: Forward Reasoning
item.description: Definition Forward reasoning, or forward chaining, is one of the two main methods for reasoning about the correctness of a program (the other being backward reasoning).

item.title: Postcondition
item.description: Definition In a method (or specification), a postcondition is a condition or predicate [link needed] that is guaranteed to hold after the method, provided that the precondition(s) (if any) are met prior to the method.

item.title: Precondition
item.description: Definition In a method (or specification), a precondition is a condition or predicate [link needed] that must be true prior to the method to ensure a meaningful result (i.
